availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Fenn Stone (Louisville, Kentucky, carriage maker)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, carriage maker. Connecticut native. Married to Laura E. Clarke Stone. Father of Ferdinand D. Stone, Julia Stone, Emily Stone, Alice Stone, Samuel Stone, and Eddie Stone. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Carriage maker in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville District 1, p. 53A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville Ward 3, p. 678.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville Ward 6, p. 595A.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Fenn Stone (1812-1898)," Memorial #94175045, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94175045 (accessed August 20, 2019).
